title: Syringa Story Map
author: Rodriguez, Denessy; Smith, Joe
description: As part of her University of Idaho CDIL fellowship, Denessy Rodriguez created a Story Map using Esri software to detail the story of Syringa and compare it against national trends. The Story Map includes a timeline of the park, photos of the park, and Idaho and national maps.

title: Syringa Short Documentary
author: Isabel Robles; Denessy Rodriguez; Cynthia Ballesteros
description: In 2018, Isabel Robles, Denessy Rodriguez, and Cynthia Ballesteros, three undergradate students at the University of Idaho, collaberated to create a ten minute video detailing the park closure announcement. This video was displayed at the event "Syringa Speaks," where Syringa residents were given the oppurtunity to share their story with the community.

title: Syringa Property Value, 1999-2015
author: Lincoln Smith
description: By former University of Idaho undergraduate student, Lincoln Smith. This graph displays the property values of Syringa Mobile Home Park lots, and shows their deep decline from 2013 and on, correlating with many of the water problems.

title: Syringa Speaks
description: On January 29, 2018, the University of Idaho Sociology Department hosted an open forum that offered Syringa residents the oppurtunity to speak about the issues they were experiencing. Three residents, James Ware, Dawn Tachell, and Bob Bonsall volunteered to participate.  Photography and site page provided by Tom Hansen and the organization Moscow Cares.

title: After Years of Neglect, Mobile Home Park to Close
author: Staff Report
description: Moscow-Pullman Daily News details the closure of Syringa. Writer of article is not specified.

title: The Stigma Surrounding Syringa
author: Garrett Cabeza
description: Moscow-Pullman Daily News chronicals the reputation that Syringa has had in the Moscow community. The article interviews Principal Investegator, Leontina Hormel. Written by Garrett Cabeza.

title: Syringa Eviction
author: Taylor Viydo
description: Krem News details the closure of Syringa. Written by Taylor Viyodo.

title: Searching for somewhere to go
author: Josh Babcock
description: The Lewiston Tribune featured an article describing the closure of the park and the process of finding a new place to live. Written by Josh Babcock.

title: Everybody Has a Voice
author: Andrea Levere
description: Prosperity Now, a non-profit organization located in Washington DC, used the NPR article about Syringa to highlight the importance of cooperatively owned mobile home parks and the different organizations that make it possible. Written by Andrea Levere.

title: Syringa on NPR
author: Daniel Zwerdling
description: The story of Syringa was featured on an NPR two-part report on conditions at mobile home parks in the US. The article focuses on what happens when park owners fail to take care of their communities. Written by Daniel Zwerdling.

title: Helping at Home
author: Jordan Gonzales
description: Dr. Leontina Hormel and students working with Syringa Mobile Home Park were featured in an article published by the University. Written by Jordan Gonzales.

title: Syringa Mobile Home Tenants Deal with the Consequences
author: Jenee Ryan
description: Article on the red tags that had begun to become common in the park. Resdients had mixed-feelings about the tags and what should be done. Written by Jenee Ryan.

title: An exit strategy for troubled Moscow mobile home park
author: Bill McKee
description: Article chronicling red tags that were introduced to Syringa, including sentiments among residents. Written by Bill McKee

title: Hope for Syringa Flows
author: George Wood Jr.
description: Syringa's water issues were featured on an article by the University of Idaho Argonaut in 2014.The article discusses a proposal to restore potable water to Syringa in the midst of one of the many water issue events that occured. Written by George Wood Jr.

title: Syringa residents file claim against park owner
author: Bill McKee
description: Article detailing the lawsuit that was filed against park owner, Magar E Magar, by Syringa residents with the aid of the UI Legal Clinic. Written by Bill McKee.

title: Her View: Syringa was the Canary in the Coal Mine
author: Leontina Hormel
description: Moscow-Pullman Daily News Op-Ed. Written by Leontina Hormel.

title: The Price (Music Video)
author: Silent Theory
description: Silent Theory

title: No Landlord: Mobile Home Community Finds Stability in Self-Government
author: Sarah Matusek
description: The Christian Science Monitor

title: Mobile home park stepping out of Syringa’s shadow
author: Anthony Kuipers
description: Moscow-Pullman Daily News

title: ‘Nowhere to go:’ Eviction of 11 Latino families sheds light on Ketchum housing crunch
author: Rachel Spacek
description: Idaho Statesman
